Class EmployeeDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • EmployeeDAO

  • public class EmployeeDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    EmployeeDAO provides a connection to the empdb.sqlite database along with CRUD methods in order to perform various operations upon the database records.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nathan Kiernan 15088410

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Statement getConnection()
        A method used to connect to the database when performing CRUD methods.
        Returns:
        A connection to the database.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        A method which closes connection to the database upon completion of CRUD methods.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the connection fails to close.

      • selectAllEmployees

        public java.util.ArrayList<Employee> selectAllEmployees()
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                        java.io.IOException
        A method which selects every employee in the database and stores them in an ArrayList. If used with Controller, all employees and their details may be printed to the console. If used with MainForm, all employees and their details may be displayed and cycled through individually.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of all employees in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

      • generateSearchQuery

        public java.util.ArrayList<Employee> generateSearchQuery(java.lang.String column,
                                                         java.lang.String searchTerm)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        A method which selects employees having an attribute value which matches the specified search value and stores them in an ArrayList. Used in a similar fashion to selectAllEmployees().
        Parameters:
        column - Specifies which database column to perform search in.
        searchTerm - Specifies which value to search database for.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of employees returned by user's search query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

      • selectEmployeeById

        public Employee selectEmployeeById(java.lang.String id)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        A method using a SQL retrieval statement in order to create an instance of an Employee using their ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID number of the desired employee record.
        Returns:
        The selected employee record as an instance of Employee.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

      • insertEmployee

        public boolean insertEmployee(Employee employee)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        A method which takes in an Employee object and adds it to the database using a SQL statement.
        Parameters:
        employee - The Employee instance of the desired employee record.
        Returns:
        A boolean corresponding to the success of the creation method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.

        public boolean deleteEmployeeById(java.lang.String id)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        A method using a SQL deletion statement in order to delete an employee record from the database using their ID.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A boolean corresponding to the success of the deletion method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

      • updateEmployee

        public boolean updateEmployee(Employee employee)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              java.io.IOException
        A method which takes in an Employee object and updates it's record in the database using a SQL statement. Used when not updating an employee's image.
        Parameters:
        employee - The Employee instance of the desired employee record.
        Returns:
        A boolean corresponding to the success of the update method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

      • updateEmployeeWithImage

        public boolean updateEmployeeWithImage(Employee employee)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        A method which takes in an Employee object and updates it's record in the database using a SQL statement. Used when updating an employee's image.
        Parameters:
        employee - The Employee instance of the desired employee record.
        Returns:
        A boolean corresponding to the success of the update method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

      • getEmployeeFromDatabase

        public Employee getEmployeeFromDatabase(java.sql.ResultSet r)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        A method which makes converting an employee record into an instance of Employee more convenient. Used by selectEmployeeById(java.lang.String), selectAllEmployees() and generateSearchQuery(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        r - The ResultSet generated by the SQL query.
        Returns:
        The selected employee record as an instance of Employee.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.
